text: <@U08EZP01H>: would you mind uploading some cropped assets?  no padding
errrr wrong chanenl

Perhaps Duplex Micropayment Channels could solve the complexity in moving funds between users. Full Nodes become PSPs as described in this paper <http://www.researchgate.net/profile/Christian_Decker5/publication/277991245_A_Fast_and_Scalable_Payment_Network_with_Bitcoin_Duplex_Micropayment_Channels/links/55780a4e08aeb6d8c01cf2d0.pdf>
Hey <@U08ERPTQF> , thanks for the fascinating reaf
Read*

That paper is really remarkable. This quote is my favorite: "If such a channel is initially funded with 1
bitcoin, the channel can be used to transfer a total of 148 billion bitcoins, an
equivalent of 35.3 trillion USD at today’s exchange rate, twice the US national
debt. Notice that both n and d can be chosen arbitrarily, further extending the
amount transferable by a channel."
Have some side-by-side comparison W/ lightning too
And it is much simpler than lightning
yeah, this article is 1) easier to read that the lightning network whitepaper, 2) seems simpler
thanks for bringing this to our attention <@U08ERPTQF> !
i spent some time yesterday reviewing the lightning network presentation: <http://lightning.network/lightning-network.pdf>
seems lightning network is roughly equal to or greater in complexity than the entire rest of the project put together.

I was searching for innovative micropayment channel concepts last night, stumbled upon this and then stayed up reading it. I'll reread it again now, but it really seems to have good potential for our use case :)
